intro: Galium verum f. puberulum, commonly known as yellow bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role as a ground cover plant in ecological and horticultural settings.
